name: negned
params: class c0, class c1, wff w0

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wne(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)))
-| wi(w0, wne(c0, c1))
-| wi(w0, wb(wne(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)), wne(c0, c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wne(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)))
-| wi(w0, wne(c0, c1))
-| wi(w0, wb(wne(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)), wne(c0, c1)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wne(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)), wne(c0, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wb(wceq(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)), wceq(c0, c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wne(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)))
-| wi(w0, wne(c0, c1))
-| wi(w0, wb(wceq(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)), wceq(c0, c1)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wceq(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)), wceq(c0, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cc))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cc))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wne(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)))
-| wi(w0, wne(c0, c1))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cc))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cc))

comment: If two complex numbers are unequal, so are their negatives. Contrapositive of ~ neg11d . (Contributed by David Moews, 28-Feb-2017.)
